intro: Hackelia hendersonii var. trachyphylla, commonly known as the roughleaf hedgenut, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring. The leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a rough, hairy texture that gives the plant its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or open habitats. This variety is part of the Caprifoliaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
